com.github.dandelion.core.config

Class Profile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dandelion.core.config.Profile

  • public class Profile
extends Object

    A Profile is typically used to activate a set of configurations which may vary depending on the target environment (e.g. dev, qa, prod).

    A Profile is activated using the "dandelion.profile.active" system property and will tell Dandelion to load the configuration file using the following syntax: dandelion_[activeProfile].properties.

    Note that only one profile can be activated at a time.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Thibault Duchateau
    See Also:
    StandardConfigurationLoader

    • Method Detail

      • getActiveProfile

        public static String getActiveProfile()

        Retrieves the current active profile.

        Some words are reserved and allow Dandelion to use a preconfigured set of configurations:

        • "" (empty or null), "dev" or "development": all these words will lead to activate the "dev" profile, and thus to use all default development values of each DandelionConfig entry.
        • "prod" or "production": these words will lead to activate the "prod" profile, and thus to use all default production values of each DandelionConfig entry.
        Returns:
        • "dev" if the "dandelion.profile.active" system property is set to "", "dev" or "development"
        • "prod" if the "dandelion.profile.active" system property is set to "prod" or "production"
        • otherwise the active profile, trimmed.

      • getActiveRawProfile

        public static String getActiveRawProfile()

        Retrieves the current and untouched active profile.

        Returns:
        the raw active profile, but at least trimmed if not null and empty.
